column4: Hi, how do I make "apt-get install" fast?  Googling shows something called netselect-apt, but this was apparently obsoleted.
I want "apt-get install" to download stuff at lots of megabytes per second instead of only a few kilobytes per second.
i'm don't have gui; i'm using server edition.
search apt, I believe there is some similar program
what do you mean search apt? you mean read the apt manual?
no, apt-cache search or whatever you prefer
I use netselect-apt on debian, I don't know if it "just works" on ubuntu
apt-cache search netselect gives only one result and it's not applicable.
no, netselect-apt is broken in ubuntu and was removed.
there was no search result, and i think that's debian-only too.  I guess I'll just manually enter ibiblio or something.  Thanks!
well you can use netselect and just list the repositories yourself
no, netselect is not in ubuntu anymore.
I see.  I assumed that was the one result without checking
kind of dumb that netselect got removed
